page.title: 02Local History
page.content: Stanbridge windmill has been moved from its original place in the fields and now stands in a prominent position on a hill overlooking the village. It was in use until the end of the 19th century but has now been converted into a private house. Stanbridgeford Station on the London Midland Railway was surprisingly busy with ducks reared locally being sent to London as well as plums grown locally. Luton and Dunstable families would spend Sundays on Totternhoe Knolls reached easily by train to Stanbridgeford Station.The station was closed by the Beeching axe in 1963. Totternhoe Knolls is the site of one of the strongest of early Norman castles. There was a small motte with baileys to the NW, N and E. There is evidence of Late Bronze and Early Iron Age settlement viz. E. Bronze hut ...
